meaningMnemonic: An <kanji>uncle</kanji> feels like a <kanji>father</kanji> sometimes, but he's still an <vocabulary>uncle</vocabulary> after all.
readingMnemonic:
You already know the お reading for 叔, but じ for 父 is new, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

One thing nobody knows is that your <vocabulary>uncle</vocabulary> is none other than <reading>Je</reading>sus (じ)! That technically makes God your grandfather. Don't tell anybody about this, though.
